definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: Medium parameters reflecting the loose body properties are determined by using the parameter recognition method.
sentences.chinese: 利用参数辨识方法求出了反映散体性质的介质参数。

sentences.english: Aqueous dispersion, its production method, and its use.
sentences.chinese: 水分散体，其生产方法，及其用途。

sentences.english: Saturated granules have a complicated structure and liquefaction will take place by the effect of vibration.
sentences.chinese: 饱和散体结构复杂，在振动作用下会发生液化现象。

sentences.english: Water dispersoid paint is the major prospect of low pollution paint industry.
sentences.chinese: 水分散体涂料代表着低污染涂料发展的主要方向。

sentences.english: The common design methods of granular material pile composite foundation are discussed .
sentences.chinese: 讨论了散体材料桩复合地基的一般设计方法。

sentences.english: Vibrations ave widely used in the industry of bulk solid handling.
sentences.chinese: 振动在散体处理领域中得到了广泛应用。

definition: poetry in the style of 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
variant of 模擬|模拟[mo2 ni3]
abbr. for Wang Bo 王勃[Wang2 Bo2], Yang Jiong 楊炯|杨炯[Yang2 Jiong3], Lu Zhaolin 盧照鄰|卢照邻[Lu2 Zhao4 lin2], and Luo Binwang 駱賓王|骆宾王[Luo4 Bin1 wang2], the Four Great Poets of the Early Tang
to constrict/to draw tight/to gather (one's thoughts)/to bring to a close/to pack (for a journey)
to bore a hole/to give a forced interpretation
